issue.title: wallet: migratewallet crashes "Assertion `m_wallet_flags == 0' failed"
issue.body:
`migratewallet` crashes on malformed `wallet.dat`s which is unlikely to happen with wallets created by old Bitcoin Core versions but we should probably return an error to the user instead of crashing.

<details>

<summary>Base64 encoded `wallet.dat` that causes a crash</summary>

```

```

</details>

```
bitcoind: wallet/wallet.cpp:1772: void wallet::CWallet::InitWalletFlags(uint64_t): Assertion `m_wallet_flags == 0' failed.
AddressSanitizer:DEADLYSIGNAL
=================================================================
==2322018==ERROR: AddressSanitizer: ABRT on unknown address 0x000000236e62 (pc 0x7f761dfe2eec bp 0x7f76194f46c0 sp 0x7f76194f29f0 T3)
    #0 0x7f761dfe2eec  (/lib/x86_64-linux-gnu/libc.so.6+0x8aeec) (BuildId: 79005c16293efa45b441fed45f4f29b138557e9e)
    #1 0x7f761df93fb1 in raise (/lib/x86_64-linux-gnu/libc.so.6+0x3bfb1) (BuildId: 79005c16293efa45b441fed45f4f29b138557e9e)
    #2 0x7f761df7e471 in abort (/lib/x86_64-linux-gnu/libc.so.6+0x26471) (BuildId: 79005c16293efa45b441fed45f4f29b138557e9e)
    #3 0x7f761df7e394  (/lib/x86_64-linux-gnu/libc.so.6+0x26394) (BuildId: 79005c16293efa45b441fed45f4f29b138557e9e)
    #4 0x7f761df8cec1 in __assert_fail (/lib/x86_64-linux-gnu/libc.so.6+0x34ec1) (BuildId: 79005c16293efa45b441fed45f4f29b138557e9e)
    #5 0x560e8c463c9d in wallet::CWallet::InitWalletFlags(unsigned long) /bitcoin/build_fuzz/src/wallet/./wallet/wallet.cpp:1772:5
    #6 0x560e8c41cbaa in wallet::CWallet::Create(wallet::WalletContext&, std::__cxx11::basic_string<char, std::char_traits<char>, std::allocator<char>> const&, std::unique_ptr<wallet::WalletDatabase, std::default_delete<wallet::WalletDatabase>>, unsigned long, bilingual_str&, std::vector<bilingual_str, std::allocator<bilingual_str>>&) /bitcoin/build_fuzz/src/wallet/./wallet/wallet.cpp:3070:25
    #7 0x560e8c4c4db9 in wallet::MigrateLegacyToDescriptor(std::__cxx11::basic_string<char, std::char_traits<char>, std::allocator<char>> const&, std::__cxx11::basic_string<char, std::char_traits<char>, secure_allocator<char>> const&, wallet::WalletContext&) /bitcoin/build_fuzz/src/wallet/./wallet/wallet.cpp:4463:45
    #8 0x560e8c29f469 in wallet::migratewallet()::$_0::operator()(RPCHelpMan const&, JSONRPCRequest const&) const /bitcoin/build_fuzz/src/wallet/./wallet/rpc/wallet.cpp:802:49
```

events.body:
There is a separate issue that triggered this crash in #32277.

It seems like the more general issue is that `CWallet::Create()`, relies on a heuristic for determining whether or not the wallet is `fFirstRun`, i.e. is being created:


https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/blob/cdc32994feadf3f15df3cfac5baae36b4b011462/src/wallet/wallet.cpp#L3062-L3064

and if a wallet passes that heuristic, it gets passed on to `CWallet::InitWalletFlags()` which makes really strict assumptions that if the wallet it's initializing has any flags set, we've made an internal error, which is not the case, since it's easy for a wallet file Bitcoin core doesn't control to have `m_spk_managers.empty() == true` and `m_wallet_flags != 0`. 

One solution, suggested offline by @achow101, would be to split `CWallet::Create()` into creating and loading, since offhand it seems every caller of `CWallet::Create()` should know whether or not this wallet is being created or is an existing wallet being loaded, instead of `CWallet::Create()` needing a heuristic to guess what the caller wants to be done.
